actionCalls.description: ... obtain a Business Manager user grant from the B2C Instance.
actionCalls.name: ia_getBusinessManagerUserGrant
actionCalls.label: Obtain a Business Manager User Grant

assignments.description: ... assign the active B2C Site Count to a local variable.
assignments.name: asn_activeB2CSites
assignments.label: Assign the Active B2C Site Count

assignments.description: ... take the anonymous customer identifiers and assign them to the OOBO session.
assignments.name: asn_anonOOBOIdentifiers
assignments.label: Assign the Anonymous OOBO Identifiers

assignments.description: ... capture the Contact identifiers used to identify the B2C Customer record.
assignments.name: asn_b2cCustomerListAndCustomerID
assignments.label: Capture the B2C CustomerList ID

assignments.description: ... default the CustomerList of the Contact record.
assignments.name: asn_customerIDAssignment
assignments.label: Default the B2C CustomerList

assignments.description: ... take the properties from the single B2C Site and copy them to the collection of selected values.
assignments.name: asn_selectedB2CSiteValues
assignments.label: Assign the Selected Site Values

decisions.description: ... evaluate if the OOBO CustomerID mapped to the selected storefront is valid.
decisions.name: dec_b2cSiteIsAnonCustomerIDValid
decisions.label: Was a Valid Anon CustomerID Found?

decisions.description: ... evaluate if the CustomerList associated to a given Contact is active or present.
decisions.name: dec_isB2CCustomerListActive
decisions.label: Evaluate the Contact's B2C CustomerList

decisions.description: ... evaluate if the OOBO customerAuthentication event succeeded with no errors.
decisions.name: dec_OOBOCustomerAuth
decisions.label: Was the OOBO Customer Authentication Successful?

decisions.description: ... evaluate if we can use the Contact's B2C Commerce profile for the OOBO shopping session with the specified site.
decisions.name: dec_useB2CCustomerProfileForOOBO
decisions.label: Use the Contact's B2C Commerce Customer Profile?

decisions.description: ... evaluate the configuration requirements for OOBO and determine if the user can proceed.
decisions.name: dec_validateOOBOConfigRequirements
decisions.label: Validate OOBO Configuration Requirements

rules.name: decOut_validateOOBOConfigRequirementsIsValid
rules.conditionLogic: (1 AND 2 AND 3 AND 4 AND 5) AND ((6 AND 7) OR (8 AND 9))
rules.label: Is Valid

decisions.description: ... evaluate if at least one (1) active B2C Site was retrieved
decisions.name: dec_wasActiveB2CSiteFound
decisions.label: Was an Active B2C Site Found?

decisions.description: ... evaluate if a Business Manager User Grant authToken was returned.
decisions.name: dec_wasBMUserGrantAuthTokenReturned
decisions.label: Was an AuthToken Returned?

decisions.description: ... evaluate if only one site was found among the list of available B2C Sites supporting OOBO.
decisions.name: dec_wasOnlyOneSiteFound
decisions.label: Was Only One Site Found?

dynamicChoiceSets.description: ... represents the collection of active B2C Sites mapped to the selected / filtered CustomerList.
dynamicChoiceSets.name: rcActiveB2CSites
dynamicChoiceSets.filterLogic: 1 AND 2 AND 3 AND 4 AND (5 OR 6 OR 7)

formulas.name: AnonymousOrRegistered
formulas.expression: if({!asRegistered}==True,"This OOBO Shopping Session will be as Registered User","This OOBO Shopping Session will be anonymous")

formulas.name: ContactForActivity
formulas.expression: if({!OldContactId}=={!recordId},'Contact ID : '+{!recordId},'Linked Contact updated from ContactId: '+{!OldContactId}+' to ContactId: '+{!recordId} )

formulas.description: ... evaluates which storefrontUrl to leverage -- the internalUrl or the customUrl driven by the urlType configuration.
formulas.name: frm_selectedStorefrontUrl

loops.description: ... loop over the collection of B2C Sites that are available
loops.name: loop_iterateB2CSites
loops.label: Loop Over the B2C Sites

recordLookups.description: ... retrieve the collection of active B2C Sites to validate that at least one (1) exists.
recordLookups.name: recGet_activeB2CSites
recordLookups.label: Get B2C Sites
recordLookups.filterLogic: 1 AND 2 AND 3 AND 4 AND 5 AND 6 AND (7 OR 8)

recordLookups.description: ... retrieve the contact record used to launch the OOBO flow.
recordLookups.name: recGet_contactRecord
recordLookups.label: Retrieve the Contact

fields.name: lbl_b2cCommerceRESTAPIError_Headline
fields.fieldText: Unable to Create an Order on Behalf Of Shopping Session

fields.name: DisplayText_ErrorWithAuth
fields.fieldText:
The B2C Commerce Instance's REST API Responded With an Error

An error occurred when interacting with the B2C Commerce environment and attempting to authenticate the Service Against. Please review the REST API error message(s) below for details regarding this failure.

  • The Business Manager User Grant is used to authenticate the Service Agent against the B2C Commerce Instane
  • The OOBO Customer Authentication is used to authenticate the B2C Commerce Customer (either anonymous or registered) against the selected storefront

fields.name: lbl_OOBORESTAPIError
fields.fieldText: Please resolve these error(s) prior to launching another OOBO Shopping Session. Verify that the Per-User NamedCredential for the Service Agent is configured property -- and that the password follows the SFCC "Password:ClientSecret" Based64 encoding structure.

screens.description: ... select a B2C Site based on the customerList that was identified.
screens.name: scrn_b2cSiteSelect
screens.label: Select a B2C Site

fields.name: lbl_selectB2CStorefront_headline
fields.fieldText: Please Select a B2C Commerce Storefront

fields.name: pklB2CSite
fields.fieldText: Select the B2C Site for the OOBO Shopping Experience

screens.description: ... launch the shopping session for OOBO.
screens.name: scrn_launchOOBOShoppingSession
screens.label: Launch OOBO Shopping Session

fields.name: lbl_successMessage_headline
fields.fieldText: Click on the Launch Order on Behalf of button to open the shopping session﻿

fields.name: lbl_launchOOBOSuccessMessage
fields.fieldText: The shopping session will open in a new browser tab using the below URL

fields.name: Logging_In_as
fields.fieldText: This OOBO Shopping session will be Anonymous

fields.name: lbl_OOBOSuccessCustomerDetails
fields.fieldText:
Customer Details

The OOBO shopping session will be launched for this customer.

fields.name: lbl_OOBOSuccessStorefrontDetails
fields.fieldText:
Storefront Details

The OOBO shopping session will be launched via this B2C Commerce storefront.

screens.description: ... no active B2C Sites was configured. OOBO cannot be processed.
screens.name: scrn_noActiveB2CSitesFound
screens.label: Error: No Active B2C Sites Found

fields.name: lbl_noActiveB2CSitesExistHeadline
fields.fieldText: Unable to Launch Order of Behalf Of Shopping Session

fields.name: lbl_noActiveB2CSitesIntroText
fields.fieldText:
No Active B2C Sites Exists

The Order on Behalf of Shopping session requires that at least one (1) active B2C Site is configured in this Salesforce org. The shopping session cannot be launched without this configuration pre-requisite. Please ensure that:

  • The parent B2C Instance is active
  • At least one (1) B2C CustomerList is active
  • At least one (1) B2C Site of the active B2C CustomerList is active
  • The active B2C Site has the Enable OOBO permission turned on

Please review each of these configuration properties to ensure that related Instance, CustomerList, and Site are enabled -- and then retry launching the Order on Behalf Of shopping session.

screens.description: ... no anonymous B2C Site CustomerID value was configured. OOBO cannot be processed.
screens.name: scrn_noAnonCustomerIDSiteConfig
screens.label: Error: No Anon. CustomerID Configured for Selected Site

fields.name: lbl_missingAnonPropertiesError
fields.fieldText: An Order On Behalf Of Shopping Session Could Not Be Created

fields.name: scrn_b2cSiteMissingAnonCustomerDetails
fields.fieldText:
The B2C Site Configuration is Missing the Anonymous B2C Customer ID / Customer No

The Contact that was selected is not a B2C Commerce Customer, and does not have a B2C Commerce Customer ID present on their record. Launching OOBO for this customer requires that the selected B2C Site have a OOBO CustomerID / CustomerNo pair that can be used in-place for initial site authentication.

fields.name: lbl_CustomerNoIssueFooter
fields.fieldText: Please configure the current B2C Site with a valid OOBO CustomerID and CustomerNo value -- and then try launching OOBO for this customer.

screens.description: ... explain to the user that the OOBO configuration is invalid -- and could not be advanced.
screens.name: scrn_OOBOConfigurationInvalid
screens.label: Error: OOBO Configuration Invalid

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteConfigurationInvalid_Headline
fields.fieldText: Unable to Create an Order on Behalf Of Shopping Session

fields.name: CouldNotInvokeCallout_DisplayText
fields.fieldText:
The B2C Site Configuration Is Invalid

Please validate that the selected Storefront's configuration is valid -- and is not missing key details. Review the following configuration values and note which values are missing or potentially configured incorrectly.

  • Remember to create the Per-User Named Credential for the Service Agent
  • The siteUrlType specified must have a corresponding URL define

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteClientID
fields.helpText: ... represents the namedCredential used to perform system-to-system REST API interactions between the Salesforce Platform and B2C Commerce.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteOCAPIVersion
fields.helpText: ... represents the OCAPI Version number used to drive OOBO REST API interactions.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteShopUrlType
fields.helpText: ... represents the version of the storefront url that will be used to launch the OOBO shopping session.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteInteralShopUrl
fields.helpText: ... represents the internal SFCC storefront url leveraging the base B2C Instance Url.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteCustomShopUrl
fields.helpText: ... represents the external customer-facing SFCC storefront url.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteOOBONamedCredential
fields.helpText: ... represents the per-user Named Credential used to authenticate Service Agents as B2C Commerce Business Manager Agents.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteOOBOCustomerID
fields.helpText: ... represents the CustomerID of the placeholder B2C Commerce Customer Profile used to authenticate against for non-registered OOBO shopping sessions.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteOOBOCustomerNo
fields.helpText: ... represents the CustomerNo of the placeholder B2C Commerce Customer Profile used to authenticate against for non-registered OOBO shopping sessions.

fields.name: lbl_b2cSiteConfigurationErrorFooter
fields.fieldText: Please note that the configured Shop URL type must have a valid URL value. Validate that each of these settings is configured with correct values -- and try launching the OOBO shopping session for the selected customer.

variables.description: ... records the number of active customerLists present.
variables.name: activeB2CCustomerListCount

variables.description: ... represents the collection of active B2C Sites configured for the current Salesforce org.
variables.name: activeB2CSites

variables.description: ... manages the count of active B2C Sites for the selected B2C CustomerList
variables.name: activeB2CSitesCount

variables.description: ... represents the customerList attached to the Contact
variables.name: contactCustomerListId

variables.description: ... describes whether the current shopping session is anonymous or for a specific customer
variables.name: isAnonymousShoppingSession

variables.description: ... represents the CustomerNo mapped to a given OOBO user.
variables.name: selectedOOBOCustomerNo

variables.description: ... represents the OOBO Named Credential (per-user used to authenticate an Agent).
variables.name: selectedOOBONamedCredential

variables.description: ... represents the custom storefront Url for a given B2C Site.
variables.name: selectedShopUrlCustom

variables.description: ... represents the type of shopUrl that is active for the OOBO experience.
variables.name: selectedShopUrlType

variables.description: ... represents the configured storefrontUrl (either the internal or custom based on the urlType configured).
variables.name: selectedStorefrontUrl
